ruleset.name: Code Size Rules
ruleset.description: The Code Size Ruleset contains a collection of rules that find code size related problems.

rule.name: NPathComplexity
rule.message: The method {0}() has an NPath complexity of {1}
rule.description: The NPath complexity of a method is the number of acyclic execution paths through that method. A threshold of 200 is generally considered the point where measures should be taken to reduce complexity.

rule.name: ExcessiveMethodLength
rule.description: Violations of this rule usually indicate that the method is doing too much. Try to reduce the method size by creating helper methods and removing any copy/pasted code.

rule.name: ExcessiveParameterList
rule.description: Long parameter lists can indicate that a new object should be created to wrap the numerous parameters. Basically, try to group the parameters together.

rule.name: ExcessiveClassLength
rule.description: Long Class files are indications that the class may be trying to do too much. Try to break it down, and reduce the size to something manageable.

rule.name: CyclomaticComplexity
rule.message: The {0} ''{1}'' has a Cyclomatic Complexity of {2}.
rule.description: Complexity is determined by the number of decision points in a method plus one for the method entry. The decision points are 'if', 'while', 'for', and 'case labels'. Generally, 1-4 is low complexity, 5-7 indicates moderate complexity, 8-10 is high complexity, and 11+ is very high complexity.

property.name: showClassesComplexity
property.description: Indicate if class average violation should be added to the report

property.name: showMethodsComplexity
property.description: Indicate if class average violation should be added to the report

rule.name: ExcessivePublicCount
rule.message: This class has a bunch of public methods and attributes
rule.description: A large number of public methods and attributes declared in a class can indicate the class may need to be broken up as increased effort will be required to thoroughly test it.

rule.name: TooManyFields
rule.description: Classes that have too many fields could be redesigned to have fewer fields, possibly through some nested object grouping of some of the information. For example, a class with city/state/zip fields could instead have one Address field.

rule.name: NcssMethodCount
rule.message: The method {0}() has an NCSS line count of {1}
rule.description: This rule uses the NCSS (Non Commenting Source Statements) algorithm to determine the number of lines of code for a given method. NCSS ignores comments, and counts actual statements. Using this algorithm, lines of code that are split are counted as one.

property.name: minimum
property.description: The method NCSS count reporting threshold

rule.name: NcssTypeCount
rule.message: The type has an NCSS line count of {0}
rule.description: This rule uses the NCSS (Non Commenting Source Statements) algorithm to determine the number of lines of code for a given type. NCSS ignores comments, and counts actual statements. Using this algorithm, lines of code that are split are counted as one.

property.name: minimum
property.description: The type NCSS count reporting threshold

rule.name: NcssConstructorCount
rule.message: The constructor with {0} parameters has an NCSS line count of {1}
rule.description: This rule uses the NCSS (Non Commenting Source Statements) algorithm to determine the number of lines of code for a given constructor. NCSS ignores comments, and counts actual statements. Using this algorithm, lines of code that are split are counted as one.

property.name: minimum
property.description: The constructor NCSS count reporting threshold

rule.name: TooManyMethods
rule.message: This class has too many methods, consider refactoring it.
rule.description: A class with too many methods is probably a good suspect for refactoring, in order to reduce its complexity and find a way to have more fine grained objects.
